#Malaysia's GDP growth is projected at 4.5% for 2019, driven by domestic demand. Accelerating structural reform is important to boost productivity and help achieve high income status. See the latest statement on Malaysia https://t.co/JKPwEqxoXC https://t.co/N9P7x9njfx

The Global Debt Database offers a detailed understanding of 190 countries’ debt and shows that:
✔️Public debt ratios remain high.
✔️Corporate debt is a growing problem.

Learn more, check out the latest update

A new update of the IMF’s Global Debt Database shows that total global debt (public plus private) reached US$188 trillion at the end of 2018, up by US$3 trillion compared to 2017. Learn more in our #IMFblog https://t.co/KHaJYOFFa6 #IMFdata https://t.co/QD3OArbdC1

Global debt in 2018 was relatively stable but a look beneath the surface at the data from 190 countries shows the real story. The IMF's global debt database has the latest free data and trends from 2018. Learn more, read the 🆕 #IMFblog 
https://t.co/KHaJYOFFa6 #IMFdata https://t.co/ncsG2SWs1Y

As the frequency and intensity of natural disasters is projected to increase over time with #climatechange, we can expect the social & economic impact of disasters to increase. DMD Zhang: #ClimateChange is a global problem, but it is one that affects small island states disproportionately.
